re
r July 16 1592

page.lettertext:
fol.251r
1592 16 July To my L. Trea
s
May it please yo
r
good L. To
p
vent the miscarieng, or
the slowe deliverie of my last, I have sent the tr
a
script
of it heere: and an other of that l
re
, w
ch
I writte unto yo
r
L.
e 21 of A
p
wherein you were advertised w
at
was
offered by
e states, to
e aide of
e
Kinge
in
Britaine.
I have nowe proposed it a freshe, and am promised an
answeare. But for ought I can
ceave, their answear
will be made but in generall termes (for so I am informed
in secret conference w
t
my frindes) and w
t
out any m
e
tion
of any of those pointes,
at were c
o
tened in their offer,
and my in forsaid l
re
. For it was no
fitte resolution
w
ch
they tooke at that time, but a certaine project of their
owne, w
ch
they were purposed then to propose unto the
Provinces,
if her
M
tie
would be willing to make an offer
of her assistance in that kinde of proportion, as they
had made the motion. But yet to signify so muche by
their publicke l
re
s to her M
tie
they said at that time,
that they might not, nor will not nowe undoubtedly,
lest
e Provinces should impute it for
p
sumption unto
them, to
p
judice their consentes by making former
mise
[s]
Nevertheles I am privatly assured, by some of their
assembly,
at if her Hig
nes
will be pleased, to signify to m
[e]
howe farre she will assent to their forsaid offer, to
[the]
ende they may be sure wherupon they may grownde
[.]
will
p
sently
ceede to
suading of
e Provinces.
[.]
thus attending every howre
e answear of
e
State
[s]
I will
p
sently send unto yow, I take my humble lea
ve
From
e Hage./ July 16 1592
